description: Rotate one binary digit to the right, calculate, then rotate one binary digit to the left.
formula: a(n) = A006257(A038572(n)), =n if n odd, =n-2^k+1 if n even and 2^k<=n<2^(k+1)
example: a(60)=29 because starting with 111100 the right rotation produces 011110 written as 11110 (i.e. 30) and the left rotation produces 11101 (i.e. 29)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 22 2000
